P000586.project_name: Development Bank of the Comoros Project

keywords.cdata: accounting,ADB,affiliates,Agriculture,Assets,auditors,Balance Sheets,bankruptcy,bonds,cash flows,Central Bank,commercial loans,credit policies,debt,deposits,depreciation,developed countries,development banks,development strategy,economic development,economic growth,economic performance,EIB,employment,equity capital,equity investments,expenditures,exports,feasibility studies,financial institutions,financial policies,Financial Ratios,financial resources,Financial Sector,FISCAL YEAR,fisheries,Fishing,food production,foreign exchange,Funds Flow,GDP,GDP deflator,GDP per capita,growth rate,Housing,imports,Income,Income Statements,industrialization,Inflation,inflation rate,Interest Rates,internal cash generation,lending rates,local enterprises,market prices,Maturities,maturity,oil,operating expenses,Operating Surplus,population growth,Portfolio,price controls,private housing,producers,profitability,quotas,real GDP,technical assistance,Transport,value added,value of output,working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The project would strengthen the newly created development bank by: (i) providing it with part of its resource requirements to finance projected lending to small- and medium-scale enterprises in the key sectors of the economy during the 1983-86 period; (ii) financing technical assistance to DBC for the management of the institution, project promotion and technical support to entrepreneurs as well as training of DBC's staff. The project would stimulate the development of productive sectors of the economy and foster institutional development of the new DFC bank.
